result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy L Haas

defendant.name: Haas, Jeremy L
defendant.address: 220 Willow St E, Stevens Point, WI 54481-6139

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 8:44 a.m. Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases (14CF44, 14CF162 are closed cases discharged after bing found incompetent). Cases: 14CT92,  15CM137, 15CM245, and 15CM392 are being heard as to competency. Parties have recieved competency report. Court summarizes the report and the Parties state their understanding of the report. Atty Redfield make statements. Atty Cousins makes statements. BTC: Cases are discharged but may be reviewed in the future. No further court hearings to be scheduled at this time.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-137, 14CF-44, 14CF-162, 15CM-245, 15CM-392 and 14CT-92

9:33 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances. 

Court addresses the parties. This is a continuation of a hearing.
State has expressed concerns. Court agrees with concerns of the continuing competency issue with Defendant, as though he is prosecution proof and that is armed with non competency status and therefore allowed to go about the community committing crimes without any type of consequence.

This Court asked a while ago, regarding low function in terms of IQ, special needs, that that is the underlying basis of finding him not competent and not likely to become competent to be in the program.  Court reviews what the program results were. 

Court expressed concerns in the last hearing regarding the results and the civil incompetency side of the ledger.   
This Court wanted another competency evaluation.  

Atty Redfield addresses the Court, wishes to call two witneses to establish the chain of what has happened in the chain of order.

9:39 AM L. Nazami is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of Defense.

9:46 AM M. Madlena is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Redfield.
9:51 AM Cross-examination by Atty Cousins.
9:54 AM Court addresses witness as to explanations of this process and charges of Defendant, to bring witness up to date and aware. Court explains what the Court wants further information on.
Examination by the Court.

Court requests that there be more evaluation or another evaluation from a different doctor. It may be the same conclusion but is not sure.  There needs to be some type of structure.

M. Madlena requests a court order.

Atty Cousins will prepare an order for the Court's signature.
Atty Cousins questions the Court for clarifications.
Court replies.

Court is looking for solutions to a problem.

Atty Redfield agrees with the Court's evaluation.  Competency hearing scheduled for September 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 14CF-44, 15CM-245, 14CF-162, 15CM-392 and 14CT-92. 15CM-137 has been referred to as well. 

8:42 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Older cases are set for a review or to re-evaluate competency. The newer ones are before the Court the first time to determine competency.  In the past Defendant has been found incompetent.

Court is to ask Defendant if Defendant claims to be competent or incompetent.

Defendant claims to be incompetent.

State has evidence to prove otherwise.

8:44 AM Clerk dials Dr. Rebecca Seifert (licensed psychologist).
Court addresses Dr. Seifert, is prepared to testify.

8:45 AM Rebecca Seifert is called and sworn in by the Court.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
9:33 AM Cross-examination by Atty Redfield.
9:49 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
9:52 AM Examination by the Court.

Atty Cousins has no further witnesses.
Atty Redfield has no witnesses to call.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, requests the Court to find Defendant competent for reasons stated on the record.
Atty Redfield addresses the Court, requests the Court to find Defendant not competent for reasons stated on the record.

Court addresses the parties, has heard testimony, has doctor's report to review. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds Defendant not competent and not likely to become competent. Court wants another competency evaluation, completed by another evaluating physician who routinely does that. Court wants current report to become a part of the new evaluation. Civil competency evaluation. Court will allow 2 months for the evaluation to take place.

Defendant's mother addresses the Court. Defendant does not have a GED. 

10:13 AM Court is in recess.  Hearing scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:37 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.
Atty Cousins states that there was a competency evaluation completed but they are looking to have a second evaluation completed.

BY THE COURT:
Bond ordered continued.
  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 10:00 am.
11:00 am. Attorney Jared Redfield in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Do not operate ANY vehicle without a valid driver's license.    Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.

Defendant Jeremy L Haas in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
9:05 a.m. case is called.
Address is verified by the court.
Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney makes statement to the court  re: competency issue.  Plea of NG by Attorney Redfield on behalf of the defendant.
Attorney Redfield asks for a competency hearing.
Court questions the defendant
Defendant reviews the complaint.  Court informs of the alleged charges and penalties.
Court accepts NG plea.
ADA joins in the request for a competency hearing.
State provides the court with documentation for competency hearing.
Court questions the date of last evaluation.

Court reviewed the complaint and finds probable cause.
Court will order the defendant to submit to examination to be conducted by DHS and DHS shall have access to all past and present records and the evaluation shall be completed within the next 30 days.

Court signed the order 

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:15 am.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
